DataElement.preferredName: Person National Surgical Adjuvant Breast and Bowel Project Clinical Study Participation Number
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the unique identifier assigned to a person from past participation in another clinical study, a type of research study that tests how well new medical treatments or other interventions work in people, that is sponsored by the National Surgical Adjuvant Breast and Bowel Project, a clinical trials cooperative group supported by the NCI.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Person National Surgical Adjuvant Breast and Bowel Project Clinical Study Participation
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to a person's participation in a type of research study that tests how well new medical treatments or other interventions work in people that is sponsored by the National Surgical Adjuvant Breast and Bowel Project, a clinical trials cooperative group supported by the NCI.

Property.preferredName: National Surgical Adjuvant Breast and Bowel Project Clinical Study Participating
Property.preferredDefinition: The National Surgical adjuvant Breast and Bowel Project (NSABP) is a clinical trials cooperative group supported by the NCI. The group headquarters in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania and has research sites at nearly 200 major medical centers, university hospitals, large oncology practice groups, and health maintenance organizations in the United States, Canada, Puerto Rico, and Australia. . In addition to funding from the NCI, which the NSABP has received since it began, the NSABP also receives support from other sources for ancillary studies, training, and educational programs.:Research conducted with human subjects or on material of human origin in which an investigator directly interacts with human subjects; includes development of new technologies, mechanism of human diseases, therapy, clinical trials, epidemiology, behavior and health services research. :Taking part in an activity.

Concepts.longName: National Surgical Adjuvant Breast and Bowel Project
Concepts.definition: A clinical trials cooperative group supported by the NCI. The group headquarters in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania and has research sites at nearly 200 major medical centers, university hospitals, large oncology practice groups, and health maintenance organizations in the United States, Canada, Puerto Rico, and Australia. In addition to funding from the NCI, which the NSABP has received since it began, the NSABP also receives support from other sources for ancillary studies, training, and educational programs.

Research conducted with human subjects or on material of human origin in which an investigator directly interacts with human subjects; includes development of new technologies, study of mechanisms of human diseases, therapy, clinical trials, epidemiologic, behavior, and health services research.
The act of taking part in an activity.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: unique identifier assigned to the patient by a Cooperative Group for a protocol.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Number; a concept of quantity derived from zero and units; a numeral or string of numerals that is used for identification.

Concepts.definition: A numeral or string of numerals expressing value, quantity, or identification.

DataElement.origin: NSABP CRF:National Surgical Adjuvant Breast and Bowel Project Case Report Form
